verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, as the people pressed upon him to hear the word of God, he stood by the lake of Gennesaret,
verses.web: Now while the multitude pressed on him and heard the word of God, he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret.
verses.ct: One day, as crowds were pressing in around Jesus to hear the word of God, he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret.

verses.kjv: And saw two ships standing by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them, and were washing their nets.
verses.web: He saw two boats standing by the lake, but the fishermen had gone out of them, and were washing their nets.
verses.ct: He noticed 2 boats at the water's edge. The fishermen had left them and were washing their nets.

verses.kjv: And he entered into one of the ships, which was Simon’s, and prayed him that he would thrust out a little from the land. And he sat down, and taught the people out of the ship.
verses.web: He entered into one of the boats, which was Simon’s, and asked him to put out a little from the land. He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.
verses.ct: He climbed into one of the boats — it belonged to Simon — and asked him to push out a little from shore. Then he sat down and taught the crowds from the boat.

verses.kjv: Now when he had left speaking, he said unto Simon, Launch out into the deep, and let down your nets for a draught.
verses.web: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep, and let down your nets for a catch.”
verses.ct: When he finished speaking, he told Simon, "Take the boat out into deep water and let down your nets for a catch."

verses.kjv: And Simon answering said unto him, Master, we have toiled all the night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thy word I will let down the net.
verses.web: Simon answered him, “Master, we worked all night, and took nothing; but at your word I will let down the net.”
verses.ct: Simon replied, "Master, we worked hard all night and caught nothing. But because you say so, I'll let down the net."

verses.kjv: And when they had this done, they inclosed a great multitude of fishes: and their net brake.
verses.web: When they had done this, they caught a great multitude of fish, and their net was breaking.
verses.ct: When they did, they hauled in such an enormous number of fish that their net started tearing apart.

verses.kjv: And they beckoned unto their partners, which were in the other ship, that they should come and help them. And they came, and filled both the ships, so that they began to sink.
verses.web: They beckoned to their partners in the other boat, that they should come and help them. They came, and filled both boats, so that they began to sink.
verses.ct: They signaled to their partners in the other boat to come help. They came, and both boats were filled so full of fish that they started to sink.

verses.kjv: When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.
verses.web: But Simon Peter, when he saw it, fell down at Jesus’ knees, saying, “Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord.”
verses.ct: When Simon Peter saw what had happened, he dropped to his knees in front of Jesus and said, "Go away from me, Lord — I'm a sinful man!"

verses.kjv: For he was astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught of the fishes which they had taken:
verses.web: For he was amazed, and all who were with him, at the catch of fish which they had caught;
verses.ct: He and everyone with him were completely stunned by the size of the catch they had pulled in.

verses.kjv: And so was also James, and John, the sons of Zebedee, which were partners with Simon. And Jesus said unto Simon, Fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.
verses.web: and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid. From now on you will be catching people alive.”
verses.ct: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were Simon's fishing partners, were just as amazed. But Jesus told Simon, "Don't be afraid. From now on, you'll be catching people."

verses.kjv: And when they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all, and followed him.
verses.web: When they had brought their boats to land, they left everything, and followed him.
verses.ct: As soon as they brought their boats to shore, they left everything behind and followed him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he was in a certain city, behold a man full of leprosy: who seeing Jesus fell on his face, and besought him, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
verses.web: While he was in one of the cities, behold, there was a man full of leprosy. When he saw Jesus, he fell on his face, and begged him, saying, “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”
verses.ct: While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man covered with leprosy saw him, fell facedown on the ground, and begged, "Lord, if you're willing, you can make me clean."

verses.kjv: And he put forth his hand, and touched him, saying, I will: be thou clean. And immediately the leprosy departed from him.
verses.web: He stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying, “I want to. Be made clean.” Immediately the leprosy left him.
verses.ct: Jesus reached out his hand and touched him. "I am willing," he said. "Be clean." Instantly the leprosy vanished.

verses.kjv: And he charged him to tell no man: but go, and shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing, according as Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
verses.web: He commanded him to tell no one, “But go your way, and show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing according to what Moses commanded, for a testimony to them.”
verses.ct: Jesus ordered him not to tell anyone. "Instead," he said, "go show yourself to the priest and make the offering for your cleansing that Moses commanded. This will serve as proof to everyone."

verses.kjv: But so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.
verses.web: But the report concerning him spread much more, and great multitudes came together to hear, and to be healed by him of their infirmities.
verses.ct: But word about Jesus spread even faster, and huge crowds gathered to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.

verses.kjv: And he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.
verses.web: But he withdrew himself into the desert, and prayed.
verses.ct: Jesus, however, often slipped away to deserted places to pray.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching, that there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, which were come out of every town of Galilee, and Judaea, and Jerusalem: and the power of the Lord was present to heal them.
verses.web: On one of those days, he was teaching; and there were Pharisees and teachers of the law sitting by, who had come out of every village of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was with him to heal them.
verses.ct: One day while Jesus was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting nearby. They had come from every village in Galilee, from Judaea, and from Jerusalem. The power of the Lord was present for him to heal.

verses.kjv: And, behold, men brought in a bed a man which was taken with a palsy: and they sought means to bring him in, and to lay him before him.
verses.web: Behold, men brought a paralyzed man on a cot, and they sought to bring him in to lay before Jesus.
verses.ct: Some men arrived carrying a paralyzed man on a mat, trying to find a way to bring him inside and lay him in front of Jesus.

verses.kjv: And when they could not find by what way they might bring him in because of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him down through the tiling with his couch into the midst before Jesus.
verses.web: Not finding a way to bring him in because of the multitude, they went up to the housetop, and let him down through the tiles with his cot into the middle before Jesus.
verses.ct: When they couldn't get through the crowd, they went up on the roof, removed some tiles, and lowered the man on his mat right into the middle of the room in front of Jesus.

verses.kjv: And when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.
verses.web: Seeing their faith, he said to him, “Man, your sins are forgiven you.”
verses.ct: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the man, "Friend, your sins are forgiven."

verses.kjv: And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, Who is this which speaketh blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?
verses.web: The scribes and the Pharisees began to reason, saying, “Who is this that speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, but God alone?”
verses.ct: The scribes and the Pharisees immediately started arguing among themselves: "Who does this man think he is, speaking blasphemies? Only God can forgive sins!"

verses.kjv: But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them, What reason ye in your hearts?
verses.web: But Jesus, perceiving their thoughts, answered them, “Why are you reasoning so in your hearts?
verses.ct: But Jesus knew exactly what they were thinking. He said to them, "Why are you questioning this in your hearts?"

verses.kjv: Whether is easier, to say, Thy sins be forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk?
verses.web: Which is easier to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you;’ or to say, ‘Arise and walk?’
verses.ct: "Which is easier to say — 'Your sins are forgiven,' or 'Get up and walk'?"

verses.kjv: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath power upon earth to forgive sins, (he said unto the sick of the palsy,) I say unto thee, Arise, and take up thy couch, and go into thine house.
verses.web: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins” (he said to the paralyzed man), “I tell you, arise, take up your cot, and go to your house.”
verses.ct: "But so that you'll know the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins" — he turned to the paralyzed man — "I'm telling you: get up, pick up your mat, and go home."

verses.kjv: And immediately he rose up before them, and took up that whereon he lay, and departed to his own house, glorifying God.
verses.web: Immediately he rose up before them, and took up that which he was laying on, and departed to his house, glorifying God.
verses.ct: Right then and there, the man stood up in front of everyone, picked up the mat he'd been lying on, and went home praising God.

verses.kjv: And they were all amazed, and they glorified God, and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to day.
verses.web: Amazement took hold on all, and they glorified God. They were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen strange things today.”
verses.ct: Everyone was completely amazed and gave glory to God. They were filled with fear and kept saying, "We've seen incredible things today!"

verses.kjv: And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him, Follow me.
verses.web: After these things he went out, and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax office, and said to him, “Follow me!”
verses.ct: After this, Jesus went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at his tax booth. He said to him, "Follow me."

verses.kjv: And he left all, rose up, and followed him.
verses.web: He left everything, and rose up and followed him.
verses.ct: Levi got up, left everything, and followed him.

verses.kjv: And Levi made him a great feast in his own house: and there was a great company of publicans and of others that sat down with them.
verses.web: Levi made a great feast for him in his house. There was a great crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining with them.
verses.ct: Then Levi threw a huge banquet for Jesus at his house. A large crowd of tax collectors and others were there eating with them.

verses.kjv: But their scribes and Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with publicans and sinners?
verses.web: Their scribes and the Pharisees murmured against his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with the tax collectors and sinners?”
verses.ct: The Pharisees and their scribes complained to his disciples, "Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto them, They that are whole need not a physician; but they that are sick.
verses.web: Jesus answered them, “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.
verses.ct: Jesus answered them, "Healthy people don't need a doctor — sick people do.

verses.kjv: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.
verses.web: I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”
verses.ct: I didn't come to call the righteous. I came to call sinners to repentance."

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Why do the disciples of John fast often, and make prayers, and likewise the disciples of the Pharisees; but thine eat and drink?
verses.web: They said to him, “Why do John’s disciples often fast and pray, likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink?”
verses.ct: They pressed him further: "John's disciples fast and pray regularly, and so do the disciples of the Pharisees. But your disciples just eat and drink. Why is that?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Can ye make the children of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them?
verses.web: He said to them, “Can you make the friends of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them?
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Can you make wedding guests fast while the groom is still with them?

verses.kjv: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then shall they fast in those days.
verses.web: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast in those days.”
verses.ct: But the time will come when the groom is taken away from them. When that day comes, they will fast."

verses.kjv: And he spake also a parable unto them; No man putteth a piece of a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a rent, and the piece that was taken out of the new agreeth not with the old.
verses.web: He also told a parable to them. “No one puts a piece from a new garment on an old garment, or else he will tear the new, and also the piece from the new will not match the old.
verses.ct: He also told them a parable: "Nobody tears a patch from a new garment to sew it on an old one. If you did, you'd ruin the new garment, and the new patch wouldn't match the old fabric anyway.

verses.kjv: And no man putteth new wine into old bottles; else the new wine will burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottles shall perish.
verses.web: No one puts new wine into old wine skins, or else the new wine will burst the skins, and it will be spilled, and the skins will be destroyed.
verses.ct: And nobody pours new wine into old wineskins. If you did, the new wine would burst the skins — the wine would spill out and the skins would be ruined.

verses.kjv: But new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are preserved.
verses.web: But new wine must be put into fresh wine skins, and both are preserved.
verses.ct: New wine has to go into fresh wineskins, and then both are preserved.

verses.kjv: No man also having drunk old wine straightway desireth new: for he saith, The old is better.
verses.web: No man having drunk old wine immediately desires new, for he says, ‘The old is better.’ ”
verses.ct: And no one who has been drinking aged wine wants new wine right away, because they say, 'The old is better.'"
